body_html:
@soumith, Apologies for not being clear.

What I want is to sample values from a multivariate Gaussian distribution during runtime. It seems to be a bit undoable because the following line returns error whenever the batch size is greater than 1. It will be very helpful if you could help me out with this. Please look at the code snippet I posted in my first comment. You will find that I have used this following code snippet under the forward() implementation.

m = MultivariateNormal(policy, torch.diagnol(var))
action = m.sample()

@soumith, Apologies for not being clear.
What I want is to sample values from a multivariate Gaussian distribution during runtime. Please look at the code snippet I posted in my first comment. You will find that I have used this following code snippet under the forward() implementation.

body:
@soumith, Apologies for not being clear.

What I want is to sample values from a multivariate Gaussian distribution during runtime. It seems to be a bit undoable because the following line returns error whenever the batch size is greater than 1. It will be very helpful if you could help me out with this. Please look at the code snippet I posted in my first comment. You will find that I have used this following code snippet under the `forward()` implementation.

 ```
m = MultivariateNormal(policy, torch.diagnol(var))
action = m.sample()
 ```
